metadata.name: new_method_swf_5
metadata.description: Tests NEW_METHOD opcode (0x53) - creates new object by calling method on object as constructor. Includes built-in constructors (Array, Object, Date, String, Number, Boolean) and blank method name handling.
missing_features: Function objects as constructors - current implementation only supports string properties containing constructor names, not actual function objects
User-defined constructor functions - only built-in constructors (Array, Object, Date, String, Number, Boolean) are supported
Constructor return value handling - spec says constructor return value should be discarded and new object returned, but this isn't fully tested
Proper 'this' binding for constructor calls - requires full function object implementation
Prototype chain for constructed objects - advanced feature not implemented
String/Number/Boolean wrapper objects - constructors create objects but don't properly store wrapped primitive values
Test relies on variable system which has persistence issues, causing test to output 'undefined' instead of expected value

edge_cases_tested: Built-in constructor lookup via object property
notes: Test creates object with constructor property ArrayCtor='Array'
Uses NEW_METHOD to call obj.ArrayCtor(5) to create array with length 5
Currently has known issue with variable persistence during initialization
Actual output may show 'undefined' due to variable system limitations
Blank method name handling added - returns undefined (function objects not implemented)
String, Number, Boolean constructors added but don't store primitive values yet
